title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the project's scope, objectives, and requirements, including the definition of consciousness flow (consider incorporating established neuroscientific models such as Global Workspace Theory or Integrated Information Theory), data sources (brain-computer interfaces, EEG devices, self-reported data), visualization needs (interactive dashboards, real-time tracking, statistical analysis tools), target users (researchers, therapists, educators, neuroscientists), ethical considerations (data privacy, informed consent, potential misuse of information), potential challenges or limitations (technical feasibility, scalability, interpretability of results), and system architecture (architecture patterns such as microservices, event-driven systems, or machine learning models for data processing).

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components for data ingestion, processing, storage, and visualization, as well as the communication between components.

title: Define Data Models and Schemas for Consciousness Flow Tracking System
description: Design the data models and schemas for storing and representing consciousness flow data, including individual and collective consciousness states, events, and metadata. Consider incorporating temporal data structures to capture the dynamic nature of consciousness flow over time. Additionally, explore the integration of external data sources, such as brain activity data from wearable devices or social media feeds, to enrich the consciousness flow representation. Also, consider defining APIs for data ingestion and visualization purposes.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Processing Components
description: Implement components for ingesting and processing consciousness flow data from various sources, including sensors, surveys, and other data sources.

title: Design and Implement Visualization Components
description: Design and develop the user interface and visualization components for displaying and interacting with consciousness flow data, including individual and collective visualizations.
